Instruction guide 

To get the most of this application please read the instructions carefully. 

The phone should be placed on a part of the body that has little to no movement. The best way to do this is to use a phone case, to attach the phone at the hip like in the image below. The phone can be placed in your pocket but that may require more fine tuned adjustments in the settings page.

Note: It is still recommended to configure settings even if the phone is attached at the hip.

Below are descriptions for each of the buttons on the main page. 

To use the start reaction button, first get into a stationary position. Then press the button. When the button is pressed your built in accelerometer is turned on. At that point you can start to sprint. If the settings configurations match your acceleration then the timer will start. 

Important: When you reach the end of the sprint, you must attempt to slow down rapidly. That deceleration will cause the timer to stop. 

If you pressed the start reaction button before you felt you were ready, then you can press the stop reaction button to turn off the accelerometer. 

If you would rather stop the timer manually instead of having to stop abruptly, then press the start without stop reaction instead of start reaction. 

The record times button temporarily stores any time currently on the timer, in the list titled "Recorded Times" 

The remove times clears the "Recorded Times" list. 

To manually start and stop the timer, you have the start timer and stop timer buttons. 

To reset the timer, you press the reset timer button. 

When a time is recorded, you have the option to enter the distance ran with it. If nothing is entered, then the distance defaults to zero. You must press the save button to save the time in your records. 

Records/Calendar Screen 

The calendar marks in purple, the current date. To switch between months swipe on the calendar left or right. The green highlighted dates show which dates have records with them. Select a date and press the view records button to see the records. 

Settings 
The starting reaction text, sets how quickly you must accelerate for the timer to start. 

The stopping reaction text, sets how quickly you must decelerate for the timer to stop. 

The sensor delay, makes it so that the accelerometer shuts off for a that period of time after the timer starts. This way you have time to reach a near constant speed. It also helps improve accuracy if you know how long you expect to run. If you know you will run 12 seconds in a 100 meters, then setting the delay to 10 seconds will help with timer results.
